page.title: 17Memories of Newburn Village
page.content:
You can still see remains of a turret and sections of the wall parallel to the West Rd. at Denton Sq.You can see a doorway between the two walls and the base of some small low stairs on whch stood a ladder reaching to the upper floor.
MEMORIES OF NEWBURN VILLAGE I started school at 5,at Newburn Manor School,then a Church School. Teachers were strict and used the cane when necessary.Religion was divided between the Parish Church and the 2 Chapels.School holidays were spent at Ryton-Willows,on the opposite river bank.Money was short:we only went to the seaside once a year on a free Sunday School trip by boat to South Shields. The main sources of employment were Coal Mines in Throckley and Blutcher,
